DOC.brief_summary: The Scanning Kelvin Probe measures surface electrical potential without actually touching the skin. This is a pilot study to evaluate methods of minimizing noise during Scanning Kelvin Probe measurements. This project will focus specifically on noise arising from physical movement and environmental electrical field.
DOC.brief_title: Measuring Skin Electrical Potential With the Kelvin Probe: Minimizing Noise
DOC.criteria: Age greater than 18 years chronic medical condition requiring daily medications (hypertension, diabetes, hypothyroidism, etc) movement disorders/tremors extensive scars on the hand latexallergies cardiac implantation, metallic joint/bone replacements (defibrillator or pacemaker)
